channel.title: Arch
channel.description:
I just installed arch, and put openbox windows manager on it, and it is awesome.
It took me a while to get the hang of it all, but it was all worth it.
What are your thoughts on arch?

item.title: Arch
item.dc:creator: @Dzo -Dzo-
item.description:
@Dzo wrote:

Isn’t that standard config in openbox? Or perhaps I’m thinking of fluxbox. Or perhaps I’m just crazy. Most likely the latter. By the way, nice sig mopman Anywho, during my time on arch, I’ve noticed they have fantastic documentation (especially for noobs like me) on the ArchWiki.

http://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Openbox

EDIT: I would recommend looking into fluxbox. Its far more simple to set up

Read full topic

item.title: Arch
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

alt+f2 is only run if you install something like gmrun and keybind it like that in openbox…

Read full topic

item.title: Arch
item.dc:creator: @Dzo -Dzo-
item.description:
@Dzo wrote:

Lol google fixes everything. Alt + F2 is run. From there you should be able to get a terminal.

Read full topic

item.title: Arch
item.dc:creator: @Aaronnn1 Aaronnn`
item.description:
@Aaronnn1 wrote:

But the problem is, I have openbox now idk wtf to do ;/ i installed things like conky and pypanel, but idk how to get the running! its just a grey desktop, and i can run firefox, thats it. Any help? ;[

Read full topic

item.title: Arch
item.dc:creator: @Dzo -Dzo-
item.description:
@Dzo wrote:

I really really love pacman. Its a great system for sure. I do like it more than any other package manager. I used it (arch) exclusively for a few months when I first learned about linux and really liked it but returned to the old ubuntu setup after having to reformat. I feel like I did learn a lot about linux though the experience although it was nothing compared to lfs

~Dave

Read full topic
